rca_result.root_cause: Multiple infrastructure vulnerabilities detected: Auto Scaling launch template misconfiguration preventing instance launches, VPN redundancy loss creating network connectivity risks, and high-risk Kafka configuration with replication factor of 1
evidence: AWS_EC2_AUTOSCALING_LAUNCH_TEMPLATE_NOT_FOUND event indicates missing or deleted launch template
Multiple AWS_VPN_REDUNDANCY_LOSS events showing loss of VPN tunnel redundancy
AWS_KAFKA_HIGH_RISK_CONFIG_RF_EQUALS_ONE indicates single point of failure in Kafka cluster
Multiple AWS_LAMBDA_PLANNED_LIFECYCLE_EVENT events suggesting upcoming service changes
Pattern matches historical Reference Pattern 1 and 2 with high similarity scores (0.67, 0.59)

remediation.suggestion: Address critical infrastructure misconfigurations to prevent service disruptions
checklist: Verify and recreate missing Auto Scaling launch templates
Check VPN tunnel status and restore redundancy by bringing up secondary tunnels
Review Kafka cluster configuration and increase replication factor to at least 2
Monitor Lambda lifecycle events and prepare for upcoming changes
Implement infrastructure monitoring to detect configuration drift
